body.p: A plugin can be used to customize the behavior of the entire application no matter what XML document is currently being edited. As Oxygen is a Java application most of the allowed plugin types are Java-based but there is also a Javascript-based plugin type.

There are lots of plugin types but the Workspace Access plugin type is the most versatile one. This type of plugin allows you to contribute actions to the main menu and toolbars, create custom views, interact with the application workspace, make modifications to opened documents, and add listeners for various events.

The Maven-based Oxygen SDK is freely available, comes with sample plugins and it allows you to compile Java extensions for your plugins and frameworks. But as a quick start for a Workspace Access plugin you can use this project: .
The Workspace Access plugin API can also be used with a Javascript-based plugin. Small Javascript-based plugin samples can be found here: .
You can create automated tests for your plugins: and you can also debug them using the Eclipse IDE: .
